definition: lost game/losing battle
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
narrow
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Will a surge of American soldiers turn the tide in Afghanistan?
sentences.chinese: 向阿富汗增派美军是否能扭转那里的败局？

sentences.english: For Chiang's position in Manchuria was irretrievable.
sentences.chinese: 蒋在满洲的败局明明是无法挽回的。

sentences.english: The longer we delay, the more extreme the steps that will have to be taken.
sentences.chinese: 拖得越久，挽救败局的措施就将越极端。

definition: decline (in fortune)
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
perilous situation
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to lose/to suffer defeat
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to run away (in defeat)
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
to retrieve/to redeem
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
